doc_id: Anonymous - 1768 - An act for vesting the settled estate of william nedham, esquire, in the island of Jamaica, in trustees for the purposes therein mentioned_pa.xml
text:
[7]
and other Steers and Mules, and Plantation Utensils, in the said
Island of Jamaica, whereof or wherein, or to which the herein
before named Henry Nedham, late Uncle of the said William
Nedham, was seised, possessed, interested, or entitled in Possession,
Reversion, Remainder, or Expectancy, either in Law or
Equity, at the Time of his Decease, with the Issues and Increase
of the Female Slaves, with their and every of their Appurtenances,
and the Reversion and Reversions, Remainder and Remainders,
Rents, Issues, and Profits of the said several Plantations
or Sugar-works, Lands, Tenements, Hereditaments, and
Premises, and all the Estate, Right, Title, and Interest, Property,
Claim, and Demand whatsoever of him the said William
Nedham of, in, and to the said Premises, shall from and after
the Twenty-fourth Day of June One thousand Seven hundred
and Sixty-eight, be settled upon and vested in, and the same are
hereby from thence-forth settled upon and vested in, John Pitt of
Encombe, in the County of Dorset, Esquire, and Thomas
Cholmondeley of Vale Royal, in the County of Chester, Esquire, their
Heirs and Assigns; to the Use of them the said John Pitt and
Thomas Cholmondeley, their Heirs and Assigns for ever, freed
and discharged, and absolutely acquired, exempted, and exonerated
of, from, and against all and every the Uses, Estates,
Remainders, Limitations, Trusts, annual payments, Powers,
Provisoes, Covenants, and Agreements in and by the said
Wills of the said Henry and Robert Nedham, recited Indenture
of Release of the Twenty-fourth Day of December
One thousand Seven hundred and Sixty-two, Act of Parliament,
Bargain and Sale and Release of the Thirteenth Day of June
One thousand Seven hundred and Sixty-five, or any of them,
contained, limited, created, provided, and declared of and concerning
the same (the said Annuity of Six hundred Pounds, so
given and devised to the said Elizabeth Thomas as aforesaid, only
excepted) upon Trust nevertheless, and to the Intent and Purpose,
that they the said John Pitt and Thomas Cholmondeley, and the
survivor of them, and the Heirs of such Survivor, shall and do, and
they are hereby authorized and impowered, by and with the Consent
and Approbation of the said William Nedham (if he shall be
living) such Consent and Approbation to be testified by Writing
under the Hand and Seal of the said William Nedham; and
if he shall be dead, at the Discretion and by the proper Authority
of them the said John Pitt and Thomas Cholmondeley, or of the
Survivor of them, or of the Heirs of such Survivor, to grant, bargain,
sell, release, convey, and assure the Inheritance in Fee-
simple.
